org.smtlib

Class SMT.Configuration

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.smtlib.SMT.Configuration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, SMT.IConfiguration
    Enclosing class:
    SMT

    public static class SMT.Configuration
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, SMT.IConfiguration
    The configuration object holds the values of all of the current options (e.g. command-line settings); it also holds factory objects that are used to create objects for the particular concrete syntax being used; it also holds a few internal state values

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean abort
      If true, command processing in a solver (not in check mode) aborts on the first error
      java.lang.String[] commandExtensionPrefixes
      An array of fully-qualified class name prefixes; a command name (with hyphen replaced by underscore) is appended to the prefix to obtain a fully-qualified class name that implements the command.
      ICommand.IFactory commandFactory
      The factory to use to create ICommand objects
      ICommand.IFinder commandFinder
      A class that implements ICommandFinder, whose one method returns the class object of the class that implements a command with a given name; the algorithm to identify the command class first looks for an entry in the command map above and otherwise uses this default: replace each - in the command name by _, and append the resulting string to the elements of 'commandExtensionPrefixes', looking for the first such class that exists; if relax is false (strict SMT-LIB) then the commands map and all but the initial entry of commandExtensionPrefixes are ignored.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Class<? extends ICommand>> commands
      Holds a mapping from command name to the class implementing the command
      IPrinter defaultPrinter 
      java.lang.String diag 
      boolean echo
      True if the application is to echo commands as it executes them; only applies in interactiveMode mode
      java.lang.String executable
      The path to the executable for the solver to use
      IExpr.IFactory exprFactory
      The factory to use to create IExpr objects
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> files
      The files of SMT-LIB commands to process; if null or empty then the standard input is used
      int initialInputBufferSize 
      boolean interactive
      This variable records whether we are reading from standard input, in which case the input text is usually already present.
      Log log
      The log to use for regular, error, and diagnostic output
      java.lang.String logic
      This field is set from the command-line; if set, then sets the logic used by the solver, as if the first command were the corresponding set-logic command.
      java.lang.String logicPath
      The path on which to find logic and theory definitions - currently a single directory
      boolean noshow
      If true, then information about the position of an error is not shown
      boolean nosuccess
      This field is set from the command-line and sets the initial state of the :print-success option within a solver.
      java.lang.String out
      FIXME
      int port
      The port to use for socket communications; a port > 0 supersedes any file value, but is ignored if the text option is set.
      java.lang.String prompt
      The prompt to use when needing new input from the user in an interactive mode.
      java.lang.String prompt2
      The prompt to use when in the middle of a command
      boolean relax
      When true, allows some convenience relaxations of the SMTLIB standard; when false, the standard is strictly enforced.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> reservedWords
      A list of all reserved words
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> reservedWordsNotCommands
      A list of reserved words that are not commands
      IResponse.IFactory responseFactory
      The factory to use to create IResponse objects
      IParser.IFactory smtFactory
      The factory to use to create IParser, IPos, ISource objects
      java.lang.String solvername
      The solver to use
      int solverVerbosity
      The verbosity level of the SMT solver
      ISort.IFactory sortFactory
      The factory to use to create ISort objects
      java.lang.String text
      A string containing the SMT-LIB commands to use; if null the given file is used; if non-null this text is used instead of the content of the file or the input from a port.
      boolean topLevel
      Encodes an aspect of current parser state so that we know what kind of prompt to use.
      Utils utils
      The utils object to use for utility methods
      int verbose
      True to emit diagnostic output through the SMT-LIB diagnostic channel

      SMT.Configuration()
      Creates a default configuration, initialized from org.smtlib.impl

      • commandFinder

        public ICommand.IFinder commandFinder
        A class that implements ICommandFinder, whose one method returns the class object of the class that implements a command with a given name; the algorithm to identify the command class first looks for an entry in the command map above and otherwise uses this default: replace each - in the command name by _, and append the resulting string to the elements of 'commandExtensionPrefixes', looking for the first such class that exists; if relax is false (strict SMT-LIB) then the commands map and all but the initial entry of commandExtensionPrefixes are ignored.

      • interactive

        public boolean interactive
        This variable records whether we are reading from standard input, in which case the input text is usually already present. If this field is true, then we prompt when we need additional input and we do not need to echo back an invalid command.

      • topLevel

        public boolean topLevel
        Encodes an aspect of current parser state so that we know what kind of prompt to use.
